newsitem.title: USA: Ted Turner says New web site reduces stress.
newsitem.headline: Ted Turner says New web site reduces stress.

text.p: Ted Turner's love life, health and bank account may all be a lot less stressful now that CNN's new Web site is up and running, the media mogul and sports entrepreneur -- turned humorist -- said Wednesday.

Poking fun during the unveiling of CNN Custom News, the Time Warner vice chairman and admitted non-computer geek told an audience at the Comdex computer trade show in Atlanta that "information overload" is causing many people -- himself included -- stress-related problems.
"It's affecting our love lives," he said of the recent bombardment of data from myriad sources, including dozens of TV networks and the Internet. "It's killing people!"
Of the PC on his office desk, which spits out prices for stocks he owns at breakneck speed, he said,"It's hypnotizing."
"Every few seconds it changes, up an eighth, down an eighth -- it's like playing a slot machine. I lose $20 million, I gain $20 million ..."
"Whoever I'm having lunch with will get the check depending on whether its up or down," the white-haired billionaire told a packed house at the technology conference.
CNN Custom News (www.cnn.com/customnews) is a joint venture between Time Warner Inc.'s CNN and database software maker Oracle Corp.
